Human Rights Watch head Kenneth Roth said that Obama had clearly sided with democracy but that it was not until Zine El Abidine Ben Ali "was basically out the door" that France took sides. The EU, the US and others learned a lesson, he added. Western nations had long supported the Tunisian leader, seeing him as a bulwark against Islamic militants in the region. events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role," Andy Coulson said in a statement confirming his resignation. I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on. David Cameron said he was "very sorry" Andy Coulson was going but added that he could "understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so."

Peninsula. Sergio Marchionne found this site to be a fitting location to discuss how compressed natural gas( CNG) could fuel Chrysler's future. The CEO outlined Chrysler's commitment to CNG development, stating: In the United States, there is a substantial domestic supply of CNG. CNG technology is readily available without extensive development time or expenditure of resources. Fiat already has a portfolio of CNG engines, both naturally aspirated and turbocharged. Chrysler Powertrain is actively investigating applications for CNG and is exploring solutions that would drive people to the technology. Googled Author Ken Auletta argues that the decision to pull Google( GOOG) out of China was the turning point for outgoing CEO Eric Schmidt in his decision to step down from the company's Chief Executive role. According to close advisors, the Google C.E.O. was upset a year ago when co-founder Larry Page sided with his founding partner, Sergey Brin , to withdraw censored searches from China. Eric Schmidt did not hide his belief that Google should stay in the world's largest consumer marketplace....
